Demonstrations Listed by Top-Level Domain

See the quick tour for a smaller set of demos that highlight the key features of Ptolemy II.

Ptolemy II Domains Demonstrations

Ptolemy II models that illustrate Model of Computation-oriented functionality.
  • Continuous (Continuous Time)
  • CT (Continuous Time)
  • DDF (Dynamic Dataflow)
  • DE (Discrete Events)
  • FSM (Finite State Machines)
  • HDF (Heterochronous Dataflow)
  • Modal
  • PN (Process Networks)
  • Rendezvous (Processes with synchronous communication)
  • SDF (Synchronous Dataflow)
  • SR (Synchronous/Reactive)

Continuous

An recent implementation of Continuous Time semantics, for use with the modal domain.
  • Bouncing Ball (Does not require Java 3D)
  • Brownian
  • Noise
  • Noise Spectrum
  • Poisson, IncreasingRatePoisson
  • Sampled Clocks
  • Satellite
  • Sinusoid
  • Sinusoid In Noise)
  • Static Units
  • Square Wave Response
  • Switch
  • Thermostat
  • Transmission
  • Vehicle 2 Vehicle

Continuous Time (CT)

An earlier implementation of Continuous Time semantics, for use with the Finite State Machine domain.
  • Brownian
  • Poisson
  • Sampled Clocks
  • Satellite
  • Square Wave Response

Dynamic Dataflow (DDF)

  • Eratosthenes
  • Factorial
  • IfThenElse
  • IfThenElseFSM
  • Loop
  • OrderedMerge
  • RandomWalk
  • RijndaelEncryption

Discrete Events (DE)

  • Open Queueing Network
  • Inspection Paradox
  • Long Runs
  • Modal Model
  • Parallel Execution
  • Queue and Server (M/M/1 Queues)
  • Real Time Composite
  • Router
  • Smart Sender
  • SpontaneousSources
  • Timing Paradox
  • Trilateration (New in Ptolemy II 9.0)
  • Variable Delay

Finite State Machine (FSM)

An earlier implementation of Finite State Machine semantics, for use with the CT domain.
  • Alternating Bit
  • Chained Transitions
  • Blending (In the full version of Ptolemy: with codegen)
  • Modal Binary Symmetric Channel (In the full version of Ptolemy: with codegen) -->
  • State Tracker

Heterochronous Dataflow (HDF)

  • AdaptiveCoding
  • Fibonacci
  • Hysteresis
  • Merge

Modal

A newer implementation of Modal semantics, for use with the continuous domain.
  • ABP
  • Blending
  • Case
  • Chained Transitions
  • ModalBSC
  • MultipleRuns
  • StateTracker

Process Networks (PN)

  • Brock-Ackerman Anomaly
  • Nondeterministic Merge
  • Nondeterministic Merge with Feedback
  • Ordered Merge
  • Remove Nil Tokens
  • QR
  • Stack

Rendezvous

  • Barrier Synchronization
  • Resource Management
  • Sequencing
  • Write Regulator

Synchronous Dataflow (SDF)

  • Animate Vergil
  • Array
  • ApplyFFT
  • Butterfly (In the full version of Ptolemy: with codegen)
  • Case
  • ColtRandom
  • Communications demos: ConvolutionalCoder, Scrambler, TrellisDecoder, ViterbiDecoder
  • DFT Subset
  • Expression
  • Eye Diagram
  • Fixed-Point FIR Filter
  • Fixed-Point Arithmetic
  • Functional Mock-up Unit (FMU) Bouncing Ball (New in Ptolemy II 9.0)
  • Fourier Series
  • Karplus-Strong Sound Synthesis
  • LMS Adaptive Filter
  • LogisticMap
  • Maximum Entropy Spectrum
  • Matlab in SDF (Requires that Matlab be installed locally)
  • ModelDisplay
  • Model Reference
  • Multiple Runs
  • Network Integration
  • NoisySinewave
  • Objects
  • Ptolemnizer (using Python)
  • Python Integration
  • Python Record Manipulation (New in Ptolemy II 9.0)
  • Rijndael Encryption
  • Sketched Signal
  • Slider Parameter and Port Parameters
  • Spectrum
  • Sound Spectrum
  • SynthesizedVoice

Synchronous/Reactive (SR)

  • FeedbackLoop
  • GuardedCount
  • GuardedCountTimed
  • MulticoreExecution
  • TokenRing
  • TrafficLight
  • Higher-Order Components
  • IterateOverArray
  • Mobile Function
  • Model Reference
  • MulticoreExecution
  • Parallel Execution
  • Parallel Execution
  • SpontaneousSources

    Model Transformation

    • Adder (Requires Ptalon and Antlr)
    • BouncingBallX2 (Requires Java 3D, see the GR domain)
    • ConstOptimization (Using Model-Based Transformation)
    • ConstOptimization (With TransformationController)
    • ConstOptimization (Without TransformationController)
    • DiningPhilosophers
    • GameOfLife
    • HierarchyFlattening
    • MapReduce
    • MapReduceDDF
    • ModelExecution
    • ModelGeneration
    • ModelGeneration DE
    • PublisherTest
    • RegressionTest
    • SinewaveOptimization
    Ptolemy II has several generations of code generation facilities.
    ptolemy/cg/ is the most recent facility.
    ptolemy/codegen is the older facility.

    ptolemy/cg

    Newer Ptolemy code generation demos that use files in ptolemy/cg.

    ptolemy/cg Library demos

    • CompiledCompositeActor
    • ModularCG
    • ModularCGPubSub
    • Scale C
    • Scale Java

    ptolemy/cg Ptides demos

    • OnePlatform

    ptolemy/cg Ptides Luminary demos

    • Accumulator
    • Speaker
    • TimeTriggeredTunnelingBallDevice
    • TunnelingBallDevice

    ptolemy/codegen

    Older Ptolemy code generation demos that use files in ptolemy/codegen.

    C PN Code Generation

    • Gravitation
    • PN Butterfly

    C SDF Code Generation

    • Butterfly
    • Butterfly (with C CompiledCompositeActor)
    • Case
    • Life
    • LogisticMap
    • Mod4Counter
    • Scale
    • Scale with EmbeddedCFileActor (New in Ptolemy II 8.0)
    • Simple Pass Pointer
    • Simple Pass Pointer With ECFA

    Java SDF Code Generation

    • Expression demo with Java CompiledCompositeActor
    • Scale with Embedded Java

    Ontology Analysis

    • CarTracking (Dimensional analysis)
    • Simple Constant/Nonconstant Analysis
    • Simple Constant Analysis
    • Abstract Interpretation Analysis
    • Expression Monotonicity Analysis

    Applications

    Fuel System

    • Simple Tank Model (New in Ptolemy II 9.0)
    • Improved Tank Model (New in Ptolemy II 9.0)
    • Tank Model with Error Handling (New in Ptolemy II 9.0)
    • 2 Tank Model (New in Ptolemy II 9.0)
    • 2 Tank Model with Bus communication (New in Ptolemy II 9.0)
    • 2 Tank Model with Ontological Information (New in Ptolemy II 9.0)

    Power Plant

    • Power Plant Model (New in Ptolemy II 9.0)
